text:
hello this is chef john from food
whooshes comm with hot and sweet mustard

slaw that's where i do not let that
incredibly small ingredient list fool

you this is one of the great coleslaw
recipes of all time and that's not just

because it's so great as a side dish but
also because it makes such a perfect

relish or condiment to top things like
pulled pork sandwiches or fried chicken

sandwiches or maybe even a boneless baby
back rib sandwich that i may or may not

be working on as we speak
so with that let's go ahead and get

started by cutting up some cabbage and
what i have here is about a two pound

head that i'm gonna cut in half because
i'm kind of making a small batch here

and then once we have that halved in
quartered what we'll do is cut out the

core and then slice across and like half
inch ribbons and usually when we're

doing a quick coleslaw we cut it a lot
thinner because we're just gonna address

it and serve it and in that case we
usually slice it more like a quarter

inch thick but because of the next step
you're about to see it's kind of

important we cut it a little bit thicker
and i think you're gonna see why shortly

so we'll go ahead and slice up about a
pound of cabbage as shown and transfer

that into a nice big mixing bowl at
which point we're gonna do two very

important things we're gonna sprinkle
over about a tablespoon of kosher salt

which seems like a crazy amount but
don't worry all that doesn't end up in

the final salad and then once that's in
the other thing we have to do is massage

the cabbage and not only is this to mix
in the salt but we're also kind of

breaking down and softening up these
pieces of cabbage and as you'll

hopefully realize later when you make
this this does amazing things to both

the taste and the texture so we'll
perform this cabbage massage for about a

minute Orcas osh as we refer to it in
the business or until we can feel it's

nice and flexible at which point we'll
clean up a little bit and simply let

that sit for about ten minutes and
during that ten minutes you can give it

a couple toss ian's and as you do you'll
notice not only is it gonna get a little

more flexible but this all we added is
also going to start drawing out the

water which is not only going to improve
the flavor but the texture as well and

then what we'll do after that sat for
about ten minutes let's go ahead and

transfer that into a colander and rinse
it very thoroughly under cold water

which is gonna wash away any of that
excess salt but don't worry the cabbage

has absorbed a good amount it should be
perfectly seasoned and ready for our

dressing and then what we'll do once
that's rinsed his let it sit and drain

very very well and while that's
happening we can move on to make our hot

and sweet mustard dressing and that will
begin with some mayonnaise as well as of

course a mustard and we're going to use
two kinds we will use a classic Dijon as

well as a nice big spoon of green
mustard oh by the way while I think

Dijon and green mustard are perfect for
this feel free to make this with good

old-fashioned yellow mustard or any
other mustard you like I'm you are after

all the claw of your hot sweet mustard
slaw and this really should work out

quite nicely with any kind of style
mustard and yes that was a quiet Leonard

reference but don't get too excited I
ripped the Warriors and then once that

Sam we'll go ahead and sweeten this up
with some honey and I'm gonna go ahead

and add about a tablespoon and a half
but how much you add of course depends

on how sweet you want it and then after
our sweet we will do some heat in the

form of probably too much cayenne and
then we'll finish up with a little

splash of cider vinegar I know we did
forget the salt

remember our cabbage was salted but
anyway we'll go ahead and mix that up

until combined and then give it a taste
and adjust if we need but mine was

perfect which means we can go ahead and
add our cabbage and even though we've

left this draining for a while we want
to make sure we squeeze it dry which I'm

just gonna do in my hands but if you
were really into it you could squeeze

this in a towel but either way we want
to get that cabbage as dry as possible

before we add it and that's it we'll
take a spatula and give that a mix until

thoroughly combined and as soon as
that's been completed you could serve

this immediately if you want but
generally for things like this I like to

wrap it and pop it in the fridge for at
least an hour so or much longer and it's

gonna give our cabbage time to absorb
all those amazing flavors and that's it

once that's been chilled we'll go ahead
and pull it out and give it a taste

because maybe we want a hotter maybe
we'll want a sweeter you never know but

I was very very happy with how mine
tasted so I went ahead and transferred

it into a serving dish
and then went full food blogger by

garnishing not only with some snipped
chives but also with some chive blossoms

which in case you're wondering is what
happens to a chive if you don't pick it

and by the way those little blossoms are
edible and if you want you can actually

tear and scatter those over your salad
but I didn't to be honest they were just

there for the pictures and after taking
a bunch of those I grabbed a fork and

went in for a taste and like I said in
the intro despite only having a few

ingredients this is an amazingly
flavorful slaw all right if everything's

gone according to plan you should have
the perfect balance between sweet and

heat and then above and beyond the
wonderful taste because of our salting

and massaging step our pieces of cabbage
are soft and flexible but they still

retain that raw crunch as you bite in so
to me it's the best of both worlds which

is why this not only makes a great side
dish but just an absolutely perfect

topping for things like pulled pork or
as I've already sort of mentioned a

boneless baby back rib sandwich which
I'm only showing at the end here since

if I had shown it earlier he would have
totally lost interest in the slaw and

nobody would have blamed it so stay
tuned for that but in the meantime I

really do hope you give this easy and
versatile hot sweet mustard slaw try

soon so head over to food riches comm
for all the ingredient amounts and
wonderful as usual and as always enjoy
you
you
